Posts.Content: Hi there,  I'm 26 and recently found a lump in my left breast just over a week ago, got seen very quickly by my GP who also found a thickening in the right breast too (which I hadn't noticed when checking myself) My referral has been booked in for Tuesday June 12th. I just wondered if there was anyone a similar age to myself that's been through this referral process? Someone told me I won't need a mammogram as I'm under 35, and now I just don't know what to expect... I do know however that I'm catching myself worrying about every possible outcome, and not really knowing where to turn. I don't want to worry people by telling them (especially as right now technically there's nothing to worry about) and the couple I have told just seemed to brush it of as 'nothing to worry about'  If anyone could share their experience with me, I'd really appreciate it x (Did post this in the new to site thread, so apologies probably should have put it here first, blame my head being all over the place right now!)
Posts.Title: Lump in breast - what to expect at breast clinic referral?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your kind words and info, it really means a lot.  My GP was very thorough with my examination, but I didn’t really have time left in my appointment to ask about the referral procedure (also my mind was somewhere else totally once she’d confirmed the lump and found the other thing)  It sounds so silly and naive of me, but I hadn’t really thought at a relatively young age I’d find anything like this.  Trying to stay positive
Posts.Title: Lump in breast - what to expect at breast clinic referral?

Posts.Content: Morning! Firstly just want to say thank you for all the support I've had on here. It meant so much in the days leading up to my referral. I've come home with good news, a fibroadenoma! All fine for now to be left as is (just supposed to keep an eye out for any changes over time) Feeling very lucky x
Posts.Title: Lump in breast - what to expect at breast clinic referral?

Posts.Content: Thank you all!  I'm looking forward to a really lovely weekend with family. Will make sure I'm not the one driving so I can celebrate properly ;)  <3
Posts.Title: Lump in breast - what to expect at breast clinic referral?
